body:
This PR adds a new `ban_time` field to the `listbanned` RPC command. 

In `banman`, the time that a node will be banned for (`normalized_ban_time_offset`) is used to determine `nBanUntil` by adding the time to `nCreateTime`. This adds a `nBanTime` field to `CBanEntry`, which allows us to neatly track the ban_time by initializing it to the offset time. The alternative is to perform arithmetic on the `nBanUntil` and `nCreateTime` to get the offset time, but this is not neat! ðââï¸

It's useful to keep track of `ban_time` as this is another data point on which to sort banned peers. I found this helpful in adding additional context columns to the GUI `bantablemodel` as part of a follow-up PR.

This PR also improves the `help listbanned` output by providing additional context to the descriptions of the `address`, `banned_until`, and `ban_created` fields.

**Master: listbanned**
```
[
  {
    "address": "1.2.3.4/32",
    "banned_until": 1617691101,
    "ban_created": 1617604701
  },
  {
    "address": "135.181.41.129/32",
    "banned_until": 1649140716,
    "ban_created": 1617604716
  }
]
```

**PR: listbanned**
```
[
  {
    "address": "1.2.3.4/32",
    "banned_until": 1617687807,
    "ban_created": 1617601407,
    "ban_time": 86400
  },
  {
    "address": "8.210.52.239/32",
    "banned_until": 1618202308,
    "ban_created": 1617597508,
    "ban_time": 604800
  }
]
```

title: net, rpc: add ban_time field to listbanned
